title: 3 Ways to Tell if Someone Blocked You on Discord

steps.title: Find a message from the user that you think blocked them.
steps.content: Find a message from the user that you think blocked them. To find a message in a Discord server, type from:username#tag , replacing username and tag with their username and tag.

steps.title: Right-click or hold on their message.
steps.content: Right-click or hold on their message. This will open a menu of options for that message.

steps.title: Select "reactions".
steps.content: Select "reactions". This will open up the reactions pane.

steps.title: Choose a reaction.
steps.content: Choose a reaction. If the user blocked you, you will see "reaction blocked" or the Discord window shake. Reactions also fail if you no longer have reaction permissions for a specific channel.

steps.title: Click on their username in a Discord server.
steps.content: Click on their username in a Discord server. This will open their profile.

steps.title: Choose "message".
steps.content: Choose "message". On a desktop, this is hidden under the triple dots.

steps.title: Send a message to them.
steps.content: Send a message to them. If your message fails to send, then it is possible they blocked you. Be aware that if their DMs are "closed" (i.e. they have DMs turned off from members of a particular server), then you will also not be able to send them a message unless you added them as a friend or if they share a server where they have their DMs open.

steps.title: Click on their username in a Discord server.
steps.content: Click on their username in a Discord server. This will open their profile.

steps.title: Choose "Send friend request".
steps.content: Choose "Send friend request". If you are blocked, the friend request will fail with an error similar to that of adding a user that does not exist.
